body: I have encountered the same, but was unsure where it had come from. As a workaround, refreshing the browser brings the tab back.

> As a workaround, refreshing the browser brings the tab back.

Confirmed

Thank you for the quick ~~fix~~ merge @imsodin :+1: 

Edit: Thanks for the quick fix @acolomb :+1:
Credit goes to @acolomb for the fix, I just merged it - apparently github attributes the latter.

issue.title: Edit Folder Defaults dialogue opening instead of Folder Specific after opening Defaults

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
Title doesn't really explain it.
If I open Actions, Settings, and then under Default Configuration, select Edit Folder Defaults, then close it, then go to one of the specific synchronised folders and choose Edit, the same windows comes up - just with the paths changed to match the folder I am editing. Therefore missing the tabs for Ignore Patterns, and the Folder ID etc.

![SyncTrazor1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25618369/111195703-7183c280-85b4-11eb-8e75-b7ff7c4844ba.PNG)

If I restart SyncThing from the menu, then it comes back as expected - and that is the only way I have found to reset it.

![SyncTrazor2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25618369/111195719-78123a00-85b4-11eb-93f7-b8fa9cd5fc51.PNG)

I can repeat this on two different servers. 

Version: SyncThing: 1.14.0
OS: Windows Server 2019

issue.title: WebUI: Editing a folder after editing folder defaults broken.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Reproduction
1. Actions → Settings → (General → Default Configuration →) Edit Folder Defaults
2. Save
3. Save
4. Click on a folder and click edit.
5. [bug] Instead of editing the folder, the 'Edit Folder Defaults' dialogue is brought up with details populated from the folder being edited.

### Workaround
1. Refresh the page between 3. and 4.

### System info
 - Firefox 87.0
 - Syncthing 1.14.0
 - Fedora 33
